attributes.action: Delivery drivers to get the right pay for the work load conditions worked in.
attributes.additional_details: As there is going to be a price increase starting April, its only fair that they get a pay increase. The money a self employed driver gets weekly or monthly goes straight to expenses for the van and leaves the drivers with bare minimum, on average £62 a day that's £1,240 a month and that's to the nearest figure, working 5 days, just allowing a driver to bring home enough for bills. People expect the drivers to do everything they say not knowing they have to deliver on average 180 parcels a day.
attributes.background: I know a delivery driver. Whether that's an increase pay, the full amount for fuel given back to the drivers not just a percentage or even they van hire price they have to pay weekly or monthly. Once a driver pays all expenses, they have none for themselves.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about pay for privately engaged workers are a matter for individual businesses, not the UK Government or Parliament.
